What This Package Does

LODopt is an R package for testing associations between cell type abundances and experimental conditions in single-cell data. It estimates optimal sample-specific normalization factors (to account for tissue size differences) via constrained optimization, then fits Generalized Linear Mixed Effects Models (GLMMs) on log-odds-transformed counts to detect differential abundance across conditions.

Common Commands

# Install package locally (from repo root)
devtools::install()

# Run all tests
devtools::test()

# Run a single test file
testthat::test_file("tests/testthat/test_LODopt.R")

# Regenerate documentation from roxygen2 comments
devtools::document()

# Check package (runs R CMD check)
devtools::check()

# Build pkgdown site (outputs to docs/)
pkgdown::build_site()

# Build vignettes
devtools::build_vignettes()

Architecture

This is a standard R package (R/, man/, tests/, vignettes/). Source code lives in three files:

  • R/main_functions.R — Contains all four core exported functions:

    • logodds_optimized_normFactors() — Primary entry point. Takes a SummarizedExperiment object, validates input, optimizes normalization factors via Rsolnp::solnp() (with auto-retry on convergence failure), then fits per-cluster GLMMs (lme4::glmer) with tryCatch error handling and an iterative loop that identifies significantly changed clusters and re-optimizes excluding them until convergence (max 10 iterations). Returns results with BH-adjusted p-values. Supports verbose parameter and accepts character names for coef_of_interest_index and unchanged_cluster_indices.
    • simulate_cellCounts_fromTissue() — Simulates tissue-level cell counts using negative binomial distributions, then downsamples via multinomial to mimic single-cell assay counts. Used for testing and benchmarking.
    • estimate_variance_w_args() — Objective function for the optimizer: computes total variance of log-odds across specified clusters. Accepts optional precomputed centering matrix for performance.
    • ineqfun_data() — Inequality constraint function for the optimizer: ensures normalized total cells per sample remain feasible.

  • R/seurat_utils.R — Contains prepare_from_seurat(), a helper that converts a Seurat object into a SummarizedExperiment ready for logodds_optimized_normFactors(). Seurat/SeuratObject are soft dependencies (in Suggests).

  • R/utils-pipe.R — Re-exports the magrittr %>% pipe operator.

Key Data Flow

  1. User constructs a SummarizedExperiment with counts assay, sample phenotype data in colData, and model parameters in metadata (formula, coefficient index or name, reference levels, seed, optional unchanged cluster indices or names). Alternatively, use prepare_from_seurat() to convert from a Seurat object.
  2. logodds_optimized_normFactors() validates input, then optimizes normalization factors by minimizing estimate_variance_w_args() subject to ineqfun_data() constraints using Rsolnp::solnp().
  3. Per-cluster binomial GLMMs are fit using the optimized normalization factors (with tryCatch for robustness).
  4. Results are returned as a data frame of log-odds ratios, raw p-values, and BH-adjusted p-values per cluster.

Key Dependencies

  • Bioconductor: SummarizedExperiment (input data structure)
  • Optimization: Rsolnp (constrained nonlinear optimization)
  • Mixed models: lme4 (GLMM fitting)
  • Simulation: dirmult (Dirichlet-multinomial distribution)
  • Optional: Seurat, SeuratObject (for prepare_from_seurat())

Testing

Tests use testthat (edition 3) and live in tests/testthat/test_LODopt.R with a runner at tests/testthat.R. Tests cover: simulation, full pipeline, input validation, name-based arguments, Seurat conversion (skipped if SeuratObject not installed), and GLMM error handling. Full pipeline tests are slow (optimization + GLMM fitting across many clusters).

CI/CD

GitHub Actions workflow at .github/workflows/R-CMD-check.yaml runs R CMD check on macOS, Windows, and Ubuntu with R 4.4 on pull requests to main.

Conventions

  • Documentation is generated via roxygen2 (#' comments in R files) — edit roxygen comments, not man/*.Rd files directly.
  • The docs/ directory is generated by pkgdown and should not be edited manually.
  • The NAMESPACE is auto-generated by roxygen2 (devtools::document()).
  • Package requires R >= 4.4.0 and Bioconductor packages (set via Additional_repositories in DESCRIPTION).
  • Never add Claude to commit messages.
